content.description:
Start with your left on a knob and your right on a good jug.  Crunch up till you can mantle.  Reach high for a slopey crimp.  Get you legs up onto the slab face and then pull and mantle your way up an easy slab finish.

There is a lot of potential for a difficult SDS variation.  If you started completely under the roof, the problem would probably be V4 or possibly higher.
content.location: This problem starts just to the left of the yucca-plant clump.  The roof is fairly pronounced and easy to see.

content.description:
This is a sit start variation on

The Shankster

.

Start with you left on a big ledge near the back of the roof and your right on a flat sidepull.  Slap up an around the roof till you get the knob, then get your left out from under the roof.  Move right to a big jug, then pull a fun, wide mantle move to reach high to a good crimp.  Finish on an easy slab.
content.location: This problem starts just to the left of the yucca-plant clump. The roof is fairly pronounced and easy to see.

content.description: Sit start the problem with a couple good crimps.  Throw high to a lip.  Once you catch the lip, there is a plethora of options to finish.  The last 6 feet of the route are extremely easy slab.
content.protection: Pad.  The landing is nice and flat.
content.location: This problem starts just to the right of the yucca-plant clump.
